page.title: 06LEGIONNAIRES DISEASE
page.content: The Stafford District General Hospital, with some of the finest facilities in the world, was struck by tragedy in 1985. Legionnaires Disease claimed 39 lives , the largest recorded death toll in a single outbreak. "The Newsletter", local press , kept the public informed concerning the disease. By May 3rd the death toll was 23. The disease was referred to as Â£the mystery flu bug.' May 7th(special edition),"The hospital water cooling tower being blamed as the source of the Legionnaires Disease." 30 dead.May 31st death toll 39. 10,000 questionnaires to be sent to out- patients.June 24th T.V. report stated "Tests on the hospitial employees proved that 243 had contracted the disease ".Death toll 39. On July 9th it was stated at Inquiry that contamin- ation of cooling system found 5 months before outbreak.Deaths at least 46.
